XGBoost Baseline API¶

Vectoriser Options¶

The slate baseline supports multiple text featurisation strategies via the --text_vectorizer CLI switch (and the matching fields on XGBoostTrainConfig):

  • tfidf – sparse TF-IDF features (default, no extra dependencies).

  • word2vec – averaged Word2Vec embeddings (requires gensim).

  • sentence_transformer – pooled Sentence-Transformer embeddings (requires the sentence-transformers package and a compatible PyTorch backend).

Use the accompanying CLI flags (--word2vec-* or --sentence-transformer-*) to tune embedding dimensionality, model checkpoints, batch sizes, and normalisation.

XGBoost-facing re-exports of the shared dataset helpers.

xgb.data.filter_dataset_for_issue(dataset, issue)[source]¶

Filter a dataset down to a specific issue label.

Parameters:

  • dataset (datasets.DatasetDict) – Dataset dictionary containing the issue column.

  • issue (str) – Issue label to retain (all preserves every row).

Returns:

Dataset dictionary restricted to rows matching issue.

Return type:

datasets.DatasetDict

xgb.data.filter_dataset_for_participant_studies(dataset, studies)[source]¶

Filter the dataset to rows whose participant_study matches studies.

Parameters:

  • dataset (datasets.DatasetDict) – Dataset dictionary containing the participant_study column.

  • studies (Iterable[str]) – Study identifiers to retain.

Returns:

Dataset dictionary filtered to the requested studies.

Return type:

datasets.DatasetDict

xgb.data.filter_split_for_participant_studies(split_ds, studies)[source]¶

Filter a dataset split to the requested participant_study tokens.

Parameters:

  • split_ds (datasets.Dataset) – Dataset split supporting filter().

  • studies (Sequence[str]) – Study identifiers to retain.

Returns:

Filtered dataset split covering only the requested studies.

Return type:

datasets.Dataset

xgb.data.issues_in_dataset(dataset)[source]¶

Return the list of issue labels present in the dataset.

Parameters:

dataset (datasets.DatasetDict) – Dataset dictionary containing at least one split.

Returns:

Sorted list of issue identifiers or ['all'] when absent.

Return type:

List[str]

xgb.data.load_dataset_source(source, cache_dir)[source]¶

Load a cleaned dataset from disk or from the Hugging Face Hub.

Parameters:

  • source (str) – Local directory path or Hugging Face dataset identifier.

  • cache_dir (str) – Cache directory passed to datasets.load_dataset().

Returns:

Dataset dictionary containing train and validation splits.

Return type:

datasets.DatasetDict

Raises:

  • ImportError – If datasets is unavailable.

  • ValueError – When source does not yield a datasets.DatasetDict.

  • window (int) – Context window size for Word2Vec training.

  • workers (int) – Number of worker threads used during training.

  • seed (int) – Random seed for reproducibility.

  • model_dir (str | None) – Directory containing persisted Word2Vec artefacts.

class xgb.model.XGBoostBoosterParams(learning_rate=0.1, max_depth=6, n_estimators=300, subsample=0.8, colsample_bytree=0.8, tree_method='hist', reg_lambda=1.0, reg_alpha=0.0, extra_kwargs=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

XGBoost-specific hyper-parameters used when instantiating the booster.

Variables:

  • learning_rate (float) – Gradient boosting learning rate.

  • max_depth (int) – Maximum tree depth.

  • n_estimators (int) – Number of boosting rounds.

  • subsample (float) – Row subsampling ratio applied per boosting round.

  • colsample_bytree (float) – Column subsampling ratio applied per tree.

  • tree_method (str) – Tree construction algorithm name.

  • reg_lambda (float) – L2 regularisation weight.

  • reg_alpha (float) – L1 regularisation weight.

  • extra_kwargs (Dict[str, Any] | None) – Additional keyword arguments forwarded to xgboost.XGBClassifier.

Parameters:

  • learning_rate (float)

  • max_depth (int)

  • n_estimators (int)

  • subsample (float)

  • colsample_bytree (float)

  • tree_method (str)

  • reg_lambda (float)

  • reg_alpha (float)

  • extra_kwargs (Dict[str, Any] | None)

class xgb.model.XGBoostTrainConfig(max_train=200000, seed=42, max_features=200000, vectorizer_kind='tfidf', tfidf=<factory>, word2vec=<factory>, sentence_transformer=<factory>, booster=<factory>)[source]¶

Bases: object

Configuration options controlling training behaviour.

Variables:

  • max_train (int) – Maximum number of rows sampled from the training split (0 keeps all).

  • seed (int) – Random seed used for subsampling.

  • max_features (int | None) – Maximum number of TF-IDF features (None for unlimited).

  • vectorizer_kind (str) – Feature extraction strategy (tfidf, word2vec, or sentence_transformer).

  • booster (XGBoostBoosterParams) – Hyper-parameter bundle applied when initialising the booster.

Parameters:

  • max_train (int)

  • seed (int)

  • max_features (int | None)

  • vectorizer_kind (str)

  • tfidf (TfidfConfig)

  • word2vec (Word2VecVectorizerConfig)

  • sentence_transformer (SentenceTransformerVectorizerConfig)

  • booster (XGBoostBoosterParams)

booster: XGBoostBoosterParams¶
max_features: int | None = 200000¶
max_train: int = 200000¶
seed: int = 42¶

tfidf: TfidfConfig¶

xgb.model.fit_xgboost_model(train_ds, *, config=None, extra_fields=None)[source]¶

Train an XGBoost multi-class classifier over prompt documents.

Parameters:

  • train_ds (datasets.Dataset or sequence-like) – Dataset split providing training examples.

  • config (XGBoostTrainConfig, optional) – Hyper-parameter bundle controlling training behaviour, including subsampling limits and booster hyper-parameters.

  • extra_fields (Sequence[str], optional) – Optional column names appended to the prompt document.

Returns:

Trained model bundle containing vectoriser, label encoder, and booster.

Return type:

XGBoostSlateModel

Raises:

  • ImportError – If the upstream xgboost package is unavailable.

  • RuntimeError – When the training split is empty or lacks diverse labels.

xgb.evaluate.evaluate_issue(*, model, eval_ds, issue_slug, config)[source]¶

Evaluate a trained XGBoost model on the provided evaluation split.

Parameters:

  • model (XGBoostSlateModel) – Trained model bundle used to score slate options.

  • eval_ds (datasets.Dataset or sequence-like) – Dataset split representing evaluation rows.

  • issue_slug (str) – Slug-ified representation of the issue being evaluated.

  • config (EvaluationConfig) – Evaluation configuration bundle (dataset info, extra fields, limits).

Returns:

Pair of summary metrics and per-example prediction details.

Return type:

tuple[IssueMetrics, List[Dict[str, Any]]]

Pipeline Orchestration¶

The orchestration layer exposes dedicated stages for the slate-ranking and opinion-regression tasks. Pass --tasks to python -m xgb.pipeline (or the training wrapper scripts) to select which portions to run:

  • next_video – plan and execute hyper-parameter sweeps for the slate model, promote the best configurations, and run the final validation pass.

  • opinion – run the opinion-regression sweeps independently, select the best booster parameters, and train the regression models used in downstream reporting.

When a task is disabled the generated Markdown reports now include a short note explaining that the section was intentionally skipped.

Pipeline orchestration for the XGBoost baselines.

This module manages sweep execution, evaluation, and report emission for the slate-ranking and opinion-regression XGBoost workflows.

class xgb.pipeline.OpinionStageConfig(dataset, cache_dir, base_out_dir, extra_fields, studies, max_participants, seed, max_features, tree_method, overwrite, reuse_existing)[source]¶

Bases: object

Inputs required to launch the opinion regression stage.

Parameters:

  • dataset (str) – Dataset identifier passed to the opinion stage.

  • cache_dir (str) – Cache directory for dataset loading.

  • base_out_dir (Path) – Base output directory for opinion artefacts.

  • extra_fields (Sequence[str]) – Additional prompt columns appended to documents.

  • studies (Sequence[str]) – Opinion study keys to evaluate.

  • max_participants (int) – Optional cap on participants per study.

  • seed (int) – Random seed for subsampling.

  • max_features (Optional[int]) – Maximum TF-IDF features (None keeps all).

  • tree_method (str) – Tree construction algorithm passed to XGBoost.

  • overwrite (bool) – Flag controlling whether existing artefacts may be overwritten.

  • reuse_existing (bool) – Flag enabling reuse of cached results.

xgb.pipeline.main(argv=None)[source]¶

Entry point orchestrating the full XGBoost workflow.

Parameters:

argv (Sequence[str] | None) – Optional override for command-line arguments (defaults to sys.argv[1:]).

Return type:

None

Command-line helpers for the Grail Simulation XGBoost pipeline.

Provides argument parsing, default-directory resolution, and sweep grid builders consumed by xgb.pipeline and its orchestration helpers.

Data structures describing the Grail Simulation XGBoost pipeline.

Defines sweep configuration objects, execution contexts, and selection results exchanged between the sweep, evaluation, and reporting stages.

class xgb.pipeline_context.NextVideoMetricSummary(accuracy=None, coverage=None, evaluated=None, correct=None, known_hits=None, known_total=None, known_availability=None, avg_probability=None, dataset=None, issue=None, issue_label=None, study_label=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Normalised view of slate metrics emitted by the XGBoost evaluations.

Parameters:

  • accuracy (Optional[float]) – Validation accuracy (None when unavailable).

  • coverage (Optional[float]) – Validation coverage capturing known candidate recall.

  • evaluated (Optional[int]) – Number of evaluation rows.

  • correct (Optional[int]) – Number of correct predictions.

  • known_hits (Optional[int]) – Correct predictions among known candidates.

  • known_total (Optional[int]) – Evaluations featuring at least one known candidate.

  • known_availability (Optional[float]) – Fraction of evaluations containing a known candidate.

  • avg_probability (Optional[float]) – Mean probability recorded for known predictions.

  • dataset (Optional[str]) – Dataset identifier.

  • issue (Optional[str]) – Issue key under evaluation.

  • issue_label (Optional[str]) – Human-readable issue label.

  • study_label (Optional[str]) – Human-readable study label.

class xgb.pipeline_context.OpinionSummary(mae_after=None, rmse_after=None, r2_after=None, baseline_mae=None, mae_delta=None, accuracy_after=None, baseline_accuracy=None, accuracy_delta=None, participants=None, eligible=None, dataset=None, split=None, label=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Normalised view of opinion-regression metrics.

Parameters:

  • mae_after (Optional[float]) – Mean absolute error achieved by the regressor.

  • rmse_after (Optional[float]) – Root mean squared error achieved by the regressor.

  • r2_after (Optional[float]) – Coefficient of determination achieved by the regressor.

  • baseline_mae (Optional[float]) – Baseline MAE using the no-change predictor.

  • mae_delta (Optional[float]) – Absolute MAE improvement over the baseline.

  • accuracy_after (Optional[float]) – Directional accuracy achieved by the regressor.

  • baseline_accuracy (Optional[float]) – Directional accuracy achieved by the baseline.

  • accuracy_delta (Optional[float]) – Improvement in directional accuracy over the baseline.

  • participants (Optional[int]) – Number of participants in the evaluation split.

  • eligible (Optional[int]) – Number of evaluation examples contributing to accuracy metrics.

  • dataset (Optional[str]) – Dataset identifier.

  • split (str | None) – Evaluation split name.

  • label (str | None)

Variables:

label (Optional[str]) – Human-readable study label.

class xgb.pipeline_context.SweepConfig(text_vectorizer, vectorizer_tag, learning_rate, max_depth, n_estimators, subsample, colsample_bytree, reg_lambda, reg_alpha, vectorizer_cli=<factory>)[source]¶

Bases: object

Hyper-parameter configuration evaluated during XGBoost sweeps.

Parameters:

  • text_vectorizer (str) – Vectoriser identifier (e.g. tfidf).

  • vectorizer_tag (str) – Short tag used in directory and report labels.

  • learning_rate (float) – Booster learning rate.

  • max_depth (int) – Tree depth explored during sweeps.

  • n_estimators (int) – Number of boosting rounds.

  • subsample (float) – Row subsampling ratio.

  • colsample_bytree (float) – Column subsampling ratio per tree.

  • reg_lambda (float) – L2 regularisation weight.

  • reg_alpha (float) – L1 regularisation weight.

  • vectorizer_cli (Tuple[str, ...]) – Extra CLI arguments associated with the vectoriser.

Evaluation runners for the Grail Simulation XGBoost pipeline.

Wraps the CLI entry points that execute the selected sweeps, perform cross-study checks, and run opinion regressions while honouring reuse settings configured by xgb.pipeline.

Public interface for the XGBoost pipeline report builders.

selections: Mapping[str, StudySelection]¶

Sweep orchestration helpers for the Grail Simulation XGBoost pipeline.

Constructs hyper-parameter grids, prepares CLI invocations, executes sweep runs for next-video and opinion tasks, and merges cached metrics so later stages can select the best configurations.

xgb.pipeline_sweeps.execute_opinion_sweep_tasks(tasks, *, jobs)¶

Execute opinion sweep tasks, optionally in parallel.

Parameters:

  • tasks (Sequence[OpinionSweepTask]) – Opinion sweep tasks to execute.

  • jobs (int) – Maximum number of parallel workers.

Returns:

Ordered list of opinion sweep outcomes.

Return type:

List[OpinionSweepOutcome]
